title: Mum leaves Valentine's Day card and chocolate for her five children before her burnt body is found on beach - Mirror Online
text:

A mum left a heartbreaking note to her beloved children telling them she 'loves them with all her heart' before she was found dead on a picturesque beach. 
Lisa Williams, 31, sent a loving card to her five kids along with five of their favourite bars of chocolate on February 12 to arrive in time for Valentine's Day. She then posted the note to her Facebook page. 
The next day her body was found badly burned by a security guard at a popular Newry beach in Anglesey, Wales. 
The card, with the Welsh word Cariad (meaning love) on the front, was posted on her profile with the message: "Hope this arrives in time Valentine's Day." Read More Woman's badly burned body found in a public shelter in horrific discovery at picturesque beach 
Inside, loving Lisa, from nearby Llanfaethlu, tells her "famous five" children how much she loves them, promising to see them soon. 
The devastating message reads: "I love you all with my Welsh heart, lovely Welsh (parcel), Valentine's treats and chocolate treats. Will see you all soon I promise. Kind hands, kind feet, nice words and sharing is caring." Lisa's Willams's note left for her children (Photo: Facebook) 
Underneath the news of the tragic discovery posted on the regional paper Daily Post's website, Lisa's sister Debbie Leanne Williams said: "Devastated and heartbroken as a family that we have lost our beautiful sister." 
The mayor of Holyhead and local councillors are also aware of the tragedy and friends and family have posted broken-hearted tributes to the "proud mum-of-five" who was also known as Lisa Boylan. Read More Giant Jim'll Fix It badge donated to entire town by paedo beast Jimmy Savile will finally be destroyed 
Her daughter wrote underneath: "Love you mam and miss you." 
Nadine Laura Cobbe said: "Your mam adored the bones off yous all, such kind and caring woman,she'll always be with you no matter what." The stand on Newry Beach Holyhead where the body was found (Photo: Daily Post Wales) 
Jones Lorraine Patricia wrote: "Your mam loved you and your brother's and sister so much. Im sure u all know that. Your mam was also so proud of u five. My heart goes out 2 u little one's." 
"So heartbreaking. She has left a huge imprint on a lot of hearts," Pamela Kinsella posted. 
Friend Natalie said: "Breaks my heart beautiful girl and amazing mother." 
Police are not treating the death as suspicious and the Coroner is waiting for the pathologist's report. 
A spokesman for North Wales Police said: "At approximately 10.50pm yesterday, Sunday 12 February 2017, emergency services were alerted to the discovery of a woman's body on Newry Beach, Holyhead. 
"She was pronounced dead at the scene and whilst no formal identification has taken place officers believe she is a local woman and enquiries are underway to locate and inform her next of kin. 
"At this time the death is not being treated as suspicious, and the coroner for north-west Wales has been informed." 
District Inspector Jason Higgins said: "The lady, who we believe to be local, was pronounced dead at the scene and we are now in the process of locating and informing her family. 
"Our thoughts are with them at this very difficult time." 
Operations manager for Holyhead Port Wyn Parry said: "She was found by one of our security details. 
"We are very sad to hear about it, and send our condolences to her family." Like us on Facebook
